Lloyd Noone

Front-end developer. Under Construction.

Projects

SunChaser

The idea for this app came from a persistent problem of living in the UK, a lack of sunny weather and mostly cloudy skies. My solution was to provide people with a one touch button that would find the closest city in the UK with sunny weather. It would then calculate the route to that city on public transport and display that information to the user.

Tech
GitHub:
See it live:
http://sun-chaser.herokuapp.com/

Alloted

I worked on this app over a week with 4 other people. The main aim was to get experience working on a code base with others, managing our time and using git to collaborate. The app allows users to post veg they have grown and claim vegetables in their local area that other poeple have grown.

Tech
GitHub:
See it live:
https://vegetableshare.herokuapp.com

Pacman Clone

The purpose of this project was to solidify the skills we learnt in the first 4 weeks of bootcamp by putting them to use in a project of my choice. I had 1 week to complete it. It is a Pacman clone in which I attempted to recreate the original games logic using common web development technologies.

Tech
GitHub:
See it live:
https://lloydnoone.github.io/pacman-clone/

Cigar Reviews

I made my own simple API, a database using MongoDB, bcrypt for authentication and React for the front-end. It was a solo project and I had two days to quickly put it together. It is for cigar reviews. Users are able to view cigars, register, login, add, edit comment on and remove cigars in the database served up by the API.

Tech
GitHub:
See it live:
https://cigarapi.herokuapp.com

Nomato (Zomato Clone)

In the second module of the course, we started learning React and experimenting with public API's. This project was a 48hr React-a-thon. I was pair programming with another student. We tried to copy the functionality of Zomato. User can search restaurants by location, cuisine etc. and comment and rate the resaurants.

Tech
GitHub:
See it live:
https://nomatosearch.herokuapp.com
